job_title: Work Study Student in Dalton, GA
pros: I've worked with Dalton State College for about 2 years now, and they have been so supportive of me in my college and career goals. Working here has greatly enriched my college experience and has helped me make great connections, all while helping me keep my bills paid!
cons: As a student work study position, the pay is minimum wage, and the hours are limited to only 19.5 per week.

pros: helping students is meaningful and some faculty are good to work with
cons: administration does not care about students or employees, just money. they will let students fail classes repeatedly just to collect tuition knowing the student needs to be in a different program. don't count on merit or cost of living raises, dsc has some of the lowest salaries in the usg. benefit costs increase every year while offering less, they overwork and under-appreciate everyone who actually keeps the place running.

pros: There are many great people that work there
cons: There is not a lot of room for upward movement

job_title: Assistant Professor of Economics in Dalton, GA
pros: nice people. small community. easy job
Students have a high flexibility for their hours. You will be able to attend classes full time and work here.
Co-workers were really good to work with. Campus community worked well together to accomplish the jobs that needed done.
cons: Raises were far and few between.

review_title: Tutoring at DSC is an enjoyable and rewarding experience.
pros:
This was my first job and helped me tremendously in terms of job experience. My manager, the staff, and the other tutors were very friendly and made me feel welcome. When I first started, my manager loaned me a book that taught me how to be a great tutor, which really helped.
Tutoring itself was very rewarding because I helped students improve their grades and achieve their goals. I especially enjoyed working with students who had disabilities because it allowed me to practice different educational approaches. 
I got paid hourly and had to be there during a certain time: if I had no students, I could use the free time to do my homework.
cons: The only downside is that I made minimum wage; the extra money helped, but it doesn't pay the bills.

job_title: Dalton State College Employee in Dalton, GA
pros: Environment was very positive and fun atmosphere working with college students.
cons: Working hours were not appropriate for adults with school aged children.
